title: Numbers & Counting
content: In this lesson, pupils will learn numbers from 1 to 20. Use fingers, objects, and number charts to practice counting.

title: Simple Addition
content: Addition means putting things together. Example: 2 + 3 = 5. Children practice with objects like fruits or blocks.

title: Simple Subtraction
content: Subtraction means taking away. Example: 5 â€“ 2 = 3. Children can practice with toys or candies.

title: Shapes and Colors
content: Pupils learn basic shapes such as circle, square, triangle, and rectangle. Each shape is linked with common objects.

title: Counting in Twos
content: Skip counting introduces children to multiplication. Start by counting 2, 4, 6, 8, etc.

title: Number Bonds to 10
content: Number bonds are pairs of numbers that add up to a target number. Pupils learn how numbers join to make 10.

title: Comparing Numbers
content: Pupils compare numbers using greater than (>), less than (<), or equal to (=).

title: Position and Direction
content: Children learn words like left, right, above, below, in front, and behind using classroom objects.

title: Word Problems
content: Pupils solve simple real-life problems using addition and subtraction. This builds logical thinking.
examples: Ali has 3 pencils. He buys 2 more. How many pencils in total?
If there are 6 birds and 2 fly away, how many are left?
